give way.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to be replaced by something else
give way.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Stone has given way to glass and concrete.
My anger gave way to depression.
give way.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to agree to do what someone else wants, instead of what you want, especially after a lot of discussion or argument
give way.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Despite growing pressure, the Minister of State refused to give way.
Maria seemed to despise him for giving way to her.
give way.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to break because of too much weight or pressure
give way.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The floorâ€™s rotten and likely to give way.
give way.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to stop or slow down when you are driving, in order to allow other vehicles to go first
give way.translation[0].definitions[3].e: In Britain, give way to cars coming from the right.
